meanings.sent1: She prenominates the winner of the contest before it even starts.
meanings.sent2: The committee prenominates the candidates for the election next month.
meanings.sent3: He always prenominates his favorite movie for the award, even before watching the others.

meanings.definition: To designate or select in advance.
meanings.sent1: The teacher prenominates the group leaders for the project in advance.
meanings.sent2: The company prenominates the employees who will attend the conference next week.
meanings.sent3: The cat prenominates its favorite spot on the couch before anyone else can sit there.
meanings.sent4: The wise old owl seems to prenominates the best path through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The weather forecast prenominates a sunny day for the picnic tomorrow.
